item.title: Say hello to Avalonia
item.description: This article is part of F# Advent calendar in English 2017. Introduction Avalonia is a cross-platform UI .NET framework inspired by WPF and built around XAML and bindings. Why use another UI framework, you would ask? F# already has solid WPF-based infrastructure: FsXAML, FSharp.ViewModule and pretty awesome Gjallarhorn.Bindable.WPF. There is also F# support in Xamarin which allows you write UI applications for mobile devices. But what if you need to build a cross-platform desktop applicaton (not Windows-only as in case of WPF)?
